Skylink.name: Skylink
Skylink.description:
Please refer to the {{#crossLink "Skylink/init:method"}}init(){{/crossLink}} method for a guide to initializing Skylink.
Please Note: - You must subscribe Skylink events before calling {{#crossLink "Skylink/init:method"}}init(){{/crossLink}}. - You will need an API key to use Skylink, if you do not have one you can [register for a developer account](http:// developer.temasys.com.sg) in the Skylink Developer Console.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#idl-def-RTCDataChannelState).
- This is the RTCDataChannelState of the peer.
- <u>ERROR</u> is an additional implemented state by Skylink
  for further error tracking.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE

params.name: CONNECTING
params.description:
The user agent is attempting to establish
  the underlying data transport. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object created with createDataChannel().

params.name: OPEN
params.description:
The underlying data transport is established
  and communication is possible. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object dispatched as a part of a RTCDataChannelEvent.

params.name: CLOSING
params.description:
The procedure to close down the underlying
  data transport has started.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The underlying data transport has been closed
  or could not be established.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Datachannel has occurred an error.

classitems.description: The list of datachannel protocol types. - These are the list of available datachannel protocol types expected to be received. - These protocol types are fixed. - DATA stage is thrown when JSON failed parsing string, it will then be automatically interpreted as base64 binary string. - Right now, the datachannel only supports base64 binary string transfer. - The sub-param data is NOT an actual property of each types.
classitems.name: _DC_PROTOCOL_TYPE

params.name: WRQ
params.description:
A data transfer request.
  Sent when a user requests to transfer a data.
  Received when a peer has requested to transfer a data.
  Sent in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_sendBlobDataToPeer:method"}}
  _sendBlobDataToPeer(){{/crossLink}}.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_WRQProtocolHandler:method"}}
  _WRQProtocolHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

props.name: chunkSize
props.description: The data chunk size expected to receive.

props.name: timeout
props.description: The timeout to wait for packet response.

params.name: ACK

props.name: ackN
props.description:
The acknowledge request number.
  • 0 Request accepted. First packet sent.
  • >0 Transfer is going on.
  • -1 Request rejected.

params.name: DATA
params.description:
Data binaryString has been sent or received.
  Sent when a user responses to a data transfer acknowledgement.
  Received when a peer sends a data packet.
  Sent in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_ACKProtocolHandler:method"}}
  _ACKProtocolHandler(){{/crossLink}}.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_DATAProtocolHandler:method"}}
  _DATAProtocolHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

params.name: CANCEL
params.description:
Sent to cancel data transfer.
  Received when a peer has canceled data transfer.
  Sending part is not yet implemented.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_CANCELProtocolHandler:method"}}
  _CANCELProtocolHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Sent when a timeout waiting for peer response has exceeded limit.
  Received from peer that timeout has reached its limit.
  Data transfer has failed.
  Sent in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_setDataChannelTimeout:method"}}
  _setDataChannelTimeout(){{/crossLink}}.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_ERRORProtocolHandler:method"}}
  _ERRORProtocolHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE candidate generation states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcicegatheringstate-enum).
- This is RTCIceGatheringState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: CANDIDATE_GENERATION_STATE

params.name: NEW
params.description:
The object was just created, and no networking
  has occurred yet.

params.name: GATHERING
params.description:
The ICE engine is in the process of gathering
  candidates for this RTCPeerConnection.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE engine has completed gathering. Events
  such as adding a new interface or a new TURN server will cause the
  state to go back to gathering.

classitems.description:
A candidate has just been generated (ICE gathering) and will be sent to the peer.
Part of connection establishment.

params.description: This is provided directly by the peerconnection API.

params.description: The ice candidate object.

classitems.description: Adds all ice candidate from the queue.
classitems.name: _addIceCandidateFromQueue

params.name: targetMid
params.description: The peerId of the target peer.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description:
The list of peer connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/

params.name: STABLE
params.description:
There is no offer/answer exchange in progress.
  This is also the initial state in which case the local and remote
  descriptions are empty.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_OFFER
params.description:
A local description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_OFFER
params.description:
A remote description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_PRANSWER
params.description:
A remote description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a local description of type "pranswer"
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_PRANSWER
params.description:
A local description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a remote description of type
  "pranswer" has been successfully applied.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description: The connection is closed.

classitems.description:
The list of api server data retrieval state.
- These are the states to inform the state of retrieving the
  information from the api server required to start the peer
  connection or if the browser is eligible to start the peer connection.
- This is the first event that would fired, because Skylink would retrieve
  information from the api server that is required to start the connection.
- Once the state is <u>COMPLETED</u>, Skylink is ready to start the call.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE

params.name: INIT
params.description:
Skylink has just started. No information are
  retrieved yet.

params.name: LOADING
params.description:
Skylink is starting the retrieval of the
  connection information.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
Skylink has completed retrieving the
  connection.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Skylink has occurred an error when
  retrieving the connection information.

classitems.description: The list of ready state change errors. - These are the error states from the error object error code. - ROOM_LOCKED is deprecated in 0.5.2. Please use {{#crossLink "Skylink/:attr"}}leaveRoom(){{/crossLink}} - The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE_ERROR

classitems.description: Intiailize Skylink to retrieve connection information. - IMPORTANT: Please call this method to load all server information before joining the room or doing anything else. - If you would like to set the start time and duration of the room, you have to generate the credentials. In example 3, we use the [CryptoJS](https://code.google.com/p/crypto-js/) library. - Step 1: Generate the hash. It is created by using the roomname, duration and the timestamp (in ISO String format). - Step 2: Generate the Credentials. It is is generated by converting the hash to a Base64 string and then encoding it to a URI string. - Step 3: Initialize Skylink

params.description:
To set the reconnection
  attempts when failure to connect to signaling server before aborting.
  This throws a channelConnectionError.
  - 0: Denotes no reconnection
  - -1: Denotes a reconnection always. This is not recommended.
  - > 0: Denotes the number of attempts of reconnection Skylink should do.

classitems.description:
The log levels.
- Logs are shown based on the level, if the level is highest, it shows logs
  which level are lower than theirs. If the level is lower, it shows only
  logs that are lower or are the same level, not the higher ones.
- Order from lowest to the highest is: error > warn > info > log > debug.
classitems.name: LOG_LEVEL

params.name: DEBUG
params.description: Level 5. Shows debug logs.

params.name: LOG
params.description: Level 4. Shows normal logs.

params.name: INFO
params.description: Level 3. Show informational logs related to user.

params.name: WARN
params.description: Level 2. Shows warnings.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Level 1. Shows the errors that are thrown during
  execution.

classitems.description:
Does a check condition first to check if event is required to be subscribed.
If check condition fails, it subscribes an event with
 {{#crossLink "Skylink/once:method"}}once(){{/crossLink}} method to wait for
the condition to pass to fire the callback.
classitems.name: _condition

params.name: eventName
params.description: The Skylink event.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback fired after the condition is met.

params.name: checkFirst
params.description:
The condition to check that if pass, it would fire the callback,
  or it will just subscribe to an event and fire when checkFirst is met.

params.name: condition
params.description:
The provided condition that would trigger this event.
  Return a true to fire the event.

params.name: fireAlways
params.description:
The function does not get removed onced triggered,
  but triggers everytime the event is called.

params.name: JOIN_ROOM
IN_ROOM

props.name: mid
props.description:
PeerId of the peer that is
  sending the joinRoom message.

params.name: ENTER
params.description:
Step 1 of the handshake.
  Sent as a broadcast message to inform other connected peers in the room
  that the user is the new peer joining the room.
  Received when a peer has just joined the room.
  Sent in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_inRoomHandler:method"}}
  _inRoomHandler(){{/crossLink}}.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_enterHandler:method"}}
  _enterHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

props.name: mid
props.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the enter shake.

props.name: userInfo.mediaStatus.audioMuted
props.description: If peer's audio stream is muted.

props.name: userInfo.mediaStatus.videoMuted
props.description: If peer's video stream is muted.

params.name: WELCOME
params.description:
Reponse to start createOffer().
  Sent as a respond to user to request peer to create the offer.
  Received as a response from peer that peer acknowledges the user has
  joined the room and create the offer.
  Sent in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_enterHandler:method"}}
  _enterHandler(){{/crossLink}},
  {{#crossLink "Skylink/_doOffer:method"}}_doOffer(){{/crossLink}},
  {{#crossLink "Skylink/_restartPeerConnection:method"}}
   _restartPeerConnection{{/crossLink}}.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_welcomeHandler:method"}}
  _welcomeHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

props.name: mid
props.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the welcome shake.

props.name: enableIceTrickle
props.description: Option to enable Ice trickle or not

props.name: enableDataChannel
props.description: Option to enable DataChannel or not

props.name: userInfo.mediaStatus.audioMuted
props.description: If peer's audio stream is muted.

props.name: userInfo.mediaStatus.videoMuted
props.description: If peer's video stream is muted.

props.name: target
props.description: PeerId of the peer targeted to receieve this message.

props.name: weight
props.description:
The weight of the message.
  • >=0 Weight priority message.
  • -1 Restart handshake but not refreshing peer connection object.
  • -2 Restart handshake and refresh peer connection object. This invokes a peerRestart event.

params.name: OFFER

props.name: mid
props.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the offer shake.

params.name: ANSWER
params.description:
An answer has been created as an response to the offer.
  Sent as a response to peer's offer message.
  Received as a response from peer's answer message. This is when connection is established.
  Sent in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_setLocalAndSendMessage:method"}}
  _setLocalAndSendMessage(){{/crossLink}}.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_answerHandler:method"}}
  _answerHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

props.name: mid
props.description: PeerId of the peer that is sending the enter shake.

params.name: CANDIDATE
params.description:
A peer's ICE candidate is created and received.
  Sent when onicecandidate is called.
  Received when peer sends an ice candidate.
  Sent in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_onIceCandidate:method"}}
  _onIceCandidate(){{/crossLink}}.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_candidateHandler:method"}}
  _candidateHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

props.name: mid
props.description:
PeerId of the peer that is sending the
  offer shake.

props.name: target
props.description:
PeerId that is specifically
  targeted to receive the message.

params.name: BYE
params.description:
A peer has left the room.
  Received when a peer has left the room.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_byeHandler:method"}}
  _byeHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

props.name: mid
props.description: PeerId of the peer that has left the room.

params.name: REDIRECT
params.description:
Server redirecting user or warning user.
  Received as a server warning or redirect to user.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_redirectHandler:method"}}
  _redirectHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

props.name: action
props.description:
The action to work on.
  [Rel: Skylink.SYSTEM_ACTION]

props.name: reason
props.description:
The reason of why the action is worked upon.
  [Rel: Skylink.SYSTEM_ACTION_REASON]

params.name: UPDATE_USER
params.description:
A peer's userData is updated.
  Sent when the user's userData is updated.
  Received when peer's userData is updated.
  Sent in {{#crossLink "Skylink/setUserData:method"}}
  setUserData(){{/crossLink}}.
  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_updateUserEventHandler:method"}}
  _updateUserEventHandler(){{/crossLink}}.

props.name: mid
props.description:

  Received in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_muteVideoEventHandler:method"}}

props.name: mid
props.description:
PeerId of the peer that is sending

props.name: muted

classitems.description:
Enable microphone.
- If microphone is not enabled from the beginning, user would have to reinitate the
  {{#crossLink "Skylink/joinRoom:method"}}joinRoom(){{/crossLink}}
  process and ask for microphone again.
classitems.name: enableAudio
example: SkylinkDemo.enableAudio();

classitems.description:
Disable microphone.
- If microphone is not enabled from the beginning, there is no effect.
classitems.name: disableAudio
example: SkylinkDemo.disableAudio();

classitems.description:
Enable webcam video.
- If webcam is not enabled from the beginning, user would have to reinitate the
  {{#crossLink "Skylink/joinRoom:method"}}joinRoom(){{/crossLink}}
  process and ask for webcam again.
classitems.name: enableVideo
example: SkylinkDemo.enableVideo();

classitems.description:
Disable webcam video.
- If webcam is not enabled from the beginning, there is no effect.
- Note that in a Chrome-to-chrome session, each party's peer audio
  may appear muted in when the audio is muted.
- You may follow up the bug on [here](https://github.com/Temasys/SkylinkJS/issues/14).
classitems.name: disableVideo
example: SkylinkDemo.disableVideo();
